howToInstall.title: Grabs What is it ? How to install ?
howToInstall.subtitle: Grabs is a development environment offering a combination of many features that are needed which simplify adding new features, start your project immediately and providing fast development with popular libraries.
howToInstall.description: In order to use Grabs, Node.js, Npm and Grunt must be installed. By applying the steps down below your development environment will be ready to use.

items.name: GRUNT
items.text: You can add Grunt plugins to add more tasks to your project. You can also change the existing configurations from the gruntfile.js file.

items.name: ANGULAR
items.text: Grabs comes with AngularJS. HTML5 Push State support is active and configurations are done so that all the requests are to the index.html file. You can change this behavior in app/js/config/ng-config.js file.

items.name: BOWER
items.text: With Bower you can manage your external dependencies automatically. All you need to do to get them is to edit bower.json file and issue grunt bower:install command. You can also change the configuration from gruntfile.js file's bower section.

items.name: STYLUS
items.text: Your Stylus files are automatically compiled to CSS and minified. You can configure this behavior in gruntfile.js under stylus section.

items.name: SPRITE
items.text:
Combine images under app/img/sprite directory to sprite.png file as sprite and provides automatic use of image file inside Stylus files without defining positions.

Combine images under app/img/sprite-retina directory to sprite-retina.png file as sprite and use retina sprite for devices with retine support automatically. Other files are automacitally moved to build directory. Example: app/css/global.styl.

items.name: TEMPLATE
items.text: Adds templating capabilities to your HTML. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under template section.

items.name: DEVELOPMENT MODE
items.text: In development mode CSS, HTML and JavaScript files are not minimized or combined. Also images are not compressed. When you use grunt command without any arguments, it starts in development mode.

items.name: LIVE MODE
items.text: In Live mode HTML, CSS and JavaScript files are minimized. CSS and JavaScript files are combined into a single CSS and JavaScript file. Images are compressed. File caching is disabled. You can use Live mode by issuing grunt live command.

items.name: JSHINT
items.text: JSHint, checks your JavaScript files against a standart list of rules for high quality code. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under jshint section.

items.name: CODE COMPLEXITY REPORT
items.text: Plato produces a complexity report of the JavaScript files in your project. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under plato section. You can get the report by issuing grunt report command.

items.name: HTML COMPRESS
items.text: Your HTML files are compressed while being delivered. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under htmlmin section.

items.name: IMAGE COMPRESS
items.text: Your images are compressed automatically. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under imagemin section.

items.name: JAVASCRIPT MINIMIZATION
items.text: Your JavaScript files are minimized with SourceMap support. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under uglify section.

items.name: NOTIFICATION
items.text: Grunt will notify you when errors occur via your operating system's notification system. You can define notifications for tasks that you want. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under notify_hooks section.

items.name: CACHE
items.text: Adding a timestamp to the resulting CSS, HTML, JavaScript and Image sprite files' names allows bypassing your browser's cache. For example: app.min.1408295277445.css

items.name: SERVER
items.text: Provides a server. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under connect section.

items.name: LIVERELOAD
items.text: Whenever an HTML, CSS or JavaScript file changes your browser window will be automatically refreshed. You can change these settings from gruntfile.js under connect section.

items.name: MULTILANGUAGE SUPPORT
items.text: Add multiple languages to your project. Example: homepage
